page.title: 11Denend Farm
page.content: {Denend Farm}is on the south side of the Forfar to Newtyle road one kilometre from the village.Mr. J.Graham is the tenant farmer.It used to be a{dairy farm}and Mr.Graham still sells milk.He buys this in as he no longer keeps cows. { }He has 50{Charolais}cross cattle. He buys and sells his cattle in Perth. He fattens the cattle using turnips and grass. He grows barley in four of his fields and sells it to{whisky}makers in Arbroath.He has three fields of grass and one of turnips. He has one farm worker as well as himself and he does some{contract work for other people. The farm is so called because it is at the bottom end of the{den}(a steep river valley) Gillian Crumley P. 7.
